NHAV1301121(1-3Y98/PI Sub: Maintenance of records for consumable items for availing   duty drawback claims under "Deemed Export Benefit" As per notice No. 1(FT)/DEA/2000 dated August 09, 2000 the Department of Economics Affairs,  Ministry of Finance has notified contracts executed with the assistance of some external agencies such as World Bank, Asian Development Bank and JBIC etc as eligible for availing Deemed Export Benefits" Accordingly, the Contractors of the projects financed by multilateral or bilateral agencies/funds as notified by the Department of Economic Affairs can avail duty drawback under "Deemed Export Benefits" after obtaining Project Authority Certificate (PAC) issued by NHAL 2 Recently, in one of the projects, it has been observed that the Contractor had requested for issuance of PAC to avail Deemed Export Benefits"   after completion of the project However; no records of actual consumption of POL during the construction had been mnaintained either by the contractor o by the Consultant as a result of which the actual consumption could not be properly assessed: Such a situation was entirely  avoidable, had proper records been maintained by all concerned. 3_ To avoid recurrence of such incidents, it has been decided that in case the Contractor of the projects financed by multilateral or bilateral agencies / funds as notified by Department of Economic Affairs, intends t0 avail "Deemed Export Benefits" Project Director should be informed accordingly and actual consumption records for such materials be maintained. Supervision Consultant would counter-sign the record and periodically submit it t the Project Director, NHAI for verification  The Project Director; would ensure that such   records are duly supported by  documents while forwarding PIU s recommendation to NHAI public
